On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 11:10 PM, "Fatima from Kinsta" <fatimapaczkan@kinsta.com> wrote:

Hi Heath,

I wanted to confirm that 140 installs have been alocated to your account so your next upgrade will be due at 141 installs :)

Let us know if you have any further questions!

Best regards,
Fatima

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 12:41 AM, "Heath from WP Perk" <heath@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Fatima,

Thanks for response, much appreciated. We will put at 100 sites within a week or so. Taking your advice, we will just leave the plan on the 120 one, but it would be great if you bump it to a 140 capacity for us.

Thanks again,

--

https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/1917299/square_128/heath-1521679325.jpg?1521679325 Heath from WP Perk Powered by Intercom

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 01:01 AM, "Fatima from Kinsta" <fatimapaczkan@kinsta.com> wrote:

Hello again,

Thank you for sending me the email exchange with Dora!

After reviewing the message, our finance team suggested the following in regards to the extra installs:

  • Enterprise 2: 80 normally, we can bump it to 100 sites, above 100 would need to upgrade
  • Enterprise 3: 120 normally, we can bump it to 140 sites, above 140 would need to upgrade
  • Enterprise 4: 150 normally, we can bump it to 180, above 180 would need to consider a custom plan.

At the moment you have 95 installs and you're on Enterprise 3. Our question is, how long do you think it would take until you reached the 100 installs? If it's a matter of a few days, 1-2 weeks then we'd recommend sticking to your E3 plan but if it might take one or several months, then you could downgrade, we would manually add the extra installs to your account and you'll only need to upgrade once you've reached 100 installs.

Would that work for you?

Kind regards,
Fatima

--

https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/1745898/square_128/ejnIMG_6329-1516012318.JPG?1516012318 Fatima from Kinsta

On Wed, Aug 8, 2018 at 07:32 PM, "Fatima Paczkan" <fatima.paczkan@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi there,

Pellumb asked me to jump in on the conversation since Dora's and I work closely together.
No worries, Dora is still with us however she's on a maternity leave at the moment enjoying some quality time with her family. She will be back though in a few months! :) Until then and afterwards as well, I'm very happy to help you if needed.

If you don't mind, it would be a big help if you could send that part of the conversation with Dora. It might be a faster process than me going through some previous conversations. In case this was a set thing, I'm sure it wouldn't be a problem however I would like to run that by our finance team again if that's okay.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Best regards,
Fatima

cool thanks!

On Wed, Aug 8, 2018 at 05:07 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Awesome thanks Pellumb. Let me know if you need any additional info or a copy of my previous communications with Dora. Cheers

On Wed, Aug 8, 2018 at 05:06 PM, "Pellumb Dalipi" <pellumb.dalipi@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Okay, I will pass this to the right department and they will get back to you as soon as possible.

On Wed, Aug 8, 2018 at 05:04 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ok thanks. Here is a copy of the original:

Hi Dora,

Hope you are well!

We have been upgrading our plan and migrating sites from WP Engine to Kinsta. We have now filled the 80 site plan and are using less than 50% of the storage and only around 10% of the bandwidth.

Can I still take you up on the offer to increase our site limit above 80 sites as we are not using all of our resources?

If so, can I confirm that this won’t affect the performance of our sites?

Of course once we get closer to 120 sites I will upgrade the plan again.

Thanks and speak soon,

On Wed, Aug 8, 2018 at 05:00 PM, "Pellumb Dalipi" <pellumb.dalipi@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hello there,

Dora is currently not available. What was the email about and when did you send it?

On Wed, Aug 8, 2018 at 04:58 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hey Guys, I sent an email to Dora a couple of days ago and haven't heard back. I just wanted to check in that she is still with you guys as she is normally really responsive. It was above upgrading our plan/site limits. Thanks
